name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

strengths: Do the Wave can deal 60 damage for only 3 energy with full bench
Colorless energy cost means it fits in ANY deck
Double Colorless Energy makes it attack turn 2 reliably
Lullaby provides guaranteed Sleep for only 1 energy
With PlusPower, can OHKO most Haymaker Pokemon (70 damage)
weaknesses: Fighting weakness is dangerous against Hitmonchan
Requires full bench to reach maximum damage
80 HP can be knocked out by boosted attacks
Damage decreases as bench thins out
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - powers Do the Wave turn 2
Plus Power - 60 + 10 = 70 OHKOs Hitmonchan, Electabuzz, Scyther
Scyther - free retreat, fills bench, Fighting resistant
Hitmonchan - Fighting type for Lightning weakness coverage
Computer Search - find DCE or Plus Power
Any Basic Pokemon - fill the bench
counters: Mr. Mime - Invisible Wall blocks 60 damage
Chansey - can survive and Double-edge back

competitiveHistory: Wigglytuff from Jungle was one of the most powerful and feared cards in early Pokemon TCG history. The 'Do the Wave' deck archetype built around this card rivaled Haymaker as the top competitive strategy. With a full bench, Wigglytuff dealt 60 damage for just 3 Colorless energy (easily achieved turn 2 with Double Colorless Energy), which was one PlusPower away from knocking out the format's best Basic Pokemon. The deck typically paired Wigglytuff with Scyther and Hitmonchan to fill the bench with efficient attackers. Do the Wave established a damage formula that would be revisited many times in future cards like Raichu XY and Zoroark. Some players reportedly hated this deck so much they would tear up Wigglytuff cards before tournaments.

rulings.ruling: Do the Wave counts all of YOUR Benched Pokemon, not your opponent's.
With 5 Benched Pokemon, Do the Wave does 10 + (5 x 10) = 60 damage.
If your bench is empty, Do the Wave only does 10 damage.
Lullaby guarantees the Defending Pokemon falls Asleep - no coin flip required.
Do the Wave's damage is calculated at the time of the attack. If Pokemon are knocked out during damage calculation steps, recount your bench.
